text.p: Suppose [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B} = \{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_9\}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] (over the field [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R[/mathjaxinline]). Let [mathjaxinline]w \in V[/mathjaxinline]. Then [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}}[/mathjaxinline] is an element of what space?

font.p: [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}}[/mathjaxinline] is defined to be a column of nine scalars; specifically, the nine scalars [mathjaxinline]a_1, a_2, \ldots a_9[/mathjaxinline] such that [mathjaxinline]w = a_1 v_1 + \ldots a_9v_9[/mathjaxinline].
